place.name: HIGH EASTER
place.gazetteerText: EASTER (High), a parish in Dunmow district, Essex; 4½ miles S by W of Dunmow r. station, and 8½ NW of Chelmsford. It has a post office under Chelmsford-Acres, 4, 725. Real property, £6, 005. Pop., 947. Houses, 202. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage annexed to Good Easter, in the diocese of Rochester. The church is ancient. There are an Independent chapel and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
